duties_responsibilities.duty: Build strong relationships with teams and provide strategic business partnership and mentoring to managers.
Provide input on business unit restructures, workforce planning, and succession planning.
Handle labor relations matters, manage union grievances, and ensure regulatory compliance.
Assess cost and policy implications of union negotiations and disputes.
Lead efforts to benchmark all job descriptions and analyze Human Capital trends and metrics.
Participate in the development of a variety of employee communications to ensure a great employee experience.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources with experience in industrial/organizational psychology, organizational behavior, or organizational development preferred. (Master's degree preferred)
